div.div: How did David Coleman Headley veer from a life of privilege to drugs, crime and, finally, terrorism? His dedication to one thing beyond all else: Himself.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QKeh2E&via=Digg&text=A Perfect Terrorist

div.a: The Rest Of The Internet Is Too Slow For Google Fiber

div.div: What is it like to have some of the cheapest, fastest, commercially available Internet access anywhere in the country?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/St2PXA&via=Digg&text=The Rest Of The Internet Is Too Slow For Google Fiber

div.a: L.A. Gangs: The Newest Tourist Attraction

div.div: Alfred is the guide. He’s a marine turned gangbanger turned entrepreneur. He’s cracking Inner City Jokes. His phrase. "We don’t need the windows open cuz we don’t do drive-bys."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rebpe8&via=Digg&text=L.A. Gangs: The Newest Tourist Attraction

div.a: The Great Porn Debate And Why It Should Change

div.div: The problem is that the wide-ranging high-level debate about porn heads straight for the proverbial money shot. Is most porn good or bad for women?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/St319b&via=Digg&text=The Great Porn Debate And Why It Should Change

div.a: Secret Amish Mafia Carry Guns, Drive Cadillacs, Believe In Eye For An Eye

div.div: But beneath the veil of a seemingly idyllic lifestyle lies something much more sinister – an Amish mafia, which serves as vigilante justice for the community and exposes infidelity, blackmail, and extortion plots.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V95Nxx&via=Digg&text=Secret Amish Mafia Carry Guns, Drive Cadillacs, Believe In Eye For An Eye

div.a: The 2012 Atlantic Hurricane Season In 4.5 Minutes

div.div: Hurricane season is almost over! What better way to celebrate than with a time lapse video showing the entire 2012 Hurricane Season into four and a half minutes?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TvzIUa&via=Digg&text=The 2012 Atlantic Hurricane Season In 4.5 Minutes

div.a: Pentagon Cries Poor, Starts $10 Billion Nuclear Weapon Upgrade

div.div: The Pentagon is facing its worst cash crunch in more than a decade, with potential cuts of up to a half-trillion dollars over the next decade if Congress doesn’t act soon. Yet the U.S. military still somehow found the money on Tuesday to put a down payment on a $10 billion upgrade of its nuclear weapons in Europe — y’know, just in case there’s another Cold War.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TuxELs&via=Digg&text=Pentagon Cries Poor, Starts $10 Billion Nuclear Weapon Upgrade

div.a: Henry Morton Stanley And The Pygmies Of 'Darkest Africa'

div.div: After returning from his disastrous mission to central Africa to rescue a German colonial governor, the explorer Henry Morton Stanley was eager to distract from accusations of brutality with his ‘discovery’ of African pygmies. Brian Murray explores how after Stanley’s trip the African pygmy, in the form of stereotype and allegory, made its way into late Victorian society.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U4ZnhW&via=Digg&text=Henry Morton Stanley And The Pygmies Of 'Darkest Africa'

div.a: Russian Prison Violence Caught On Tape

div.div: A six-minute video shows an inmate begging for mercy as he is kicked, slapped and punched by men in police uniforms.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y9sTvz&via=Digg&text=Russian Prison Violence Caught On Tape

div.a: How Syria Turned Off The Internet

div.div: Today all traffic from Syria to the rest of the Internet stopped and the Syrian government is the most likely culprit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wxo74z&via=Digg&text=How Syria Turned Off The Internet

div.a: Creationists Want To Build An Exact Replica Of Noah's Ark

div.div: For a new theme park, Creationists (with a little help from a geneticist, some Amish men, and generous tax breaks) are building a replica of Noah’s ark—exactly as God instructed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10625dJ&via=Digg&text=Creationists Want To Build An Exact Replica Of Noah's Ark

div.a: The Internet Is About To Gain 3 Billion New Users

div.div: Six billion cell phone subscriptions are spread across five billion of the earth’s seven billion people. Yet only two billion people are connected to the internet, which means three billion people have everything they need to connect to the internet—except a suitable device.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U4nAos&via=Digg&text=The Internet Is About To Gain 3 Billion New Users

div.a: Music Mogul's Rare Artist Interviews Now Posted Online

div.div: Because of Joe Smith's industry insider status, he was able to draw out surprisingly candid revelations from his subjects. McCartney speaks frankly about drug use by the Beatles and Jagger enjoys tea while contemplating the outlaw image and of The Rolling Stones.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TtkWtk&via=Digg&text=Music Mogul's Rare Artist Interviews Now Posted Online

div.a: Christopher Nolan Explains The Ending To 'The Dark Knight Rises'

div.div: There have been rumors that Joseph Gordon-Levitt would continue his role from "The Dark Knight Rises" by becoming the new Batman in future DC Comics films. This is believable in part because the movie ends in a way that suggests future films might be forthcoming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/115g4B3&via=Digg&text=Christopher Nolan Explains The Ending To 'The Dark Knight Rises'

div.div: Zoo Weekly asked its readers to pick which half of this woman they preferred, and why.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11j9NB4&via=Digg&text=Men's Magazine's 'Demeaning' Facebook Image Banned

div.a: It's Official! Water Ice Discovered On Mercury

div.div: It's time to add Mercury to the list of worlds where you can go ice-skating. Confirming decades of suspicion, a NASA spacecraft has spotted vast deposits of water ice on the planet closest to the sun.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ShFw1r&via=Digg&text=It's Official! Water Ice Discovered On Mercury

div.div: HE ALREADY KNOWS YOU STALK YOUR EX

div.a: How Facebook's Top Engineer Is Trying To Read Your Mind

div.div: Facebook’s director of engineering shares how the social network is trying to pump up user posts, favoring longer stories and content and adding data that will help Facebook and its partners repurpose even the simplest status updates.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SdNh8E&via=Digg&text=How Facebook's Top Engineer Is Trying To Read Your Mind

div.a: TIME 'Person Of The Year' Nomination For Higgs Boson Riddled With Errors

div.div: Every single sentence in Time’s nomination contains at least one serious error. The magazine scores a perfect five for five.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SwseOx&via=Digg&text=TIME 'Person Of The Year' Nomination For Higgs Boson Riddled With Errors

div.div: WE'RE JUST NOT THAT INTO YOU, COMCAST

Comcast right now is like the girlfriend I’ve decided to break up with, but not until I’ve found a new apartment to live in. I’ve had my eye on another gal who lives in Kansas City at the moment but whom I’m determined to convince to move into my neighborhood: Google Fiber.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SeeV5y&via=Digg&text=Google Fiber Versus Comcast

div.a: Skip To The Sexy Parts Of 'Fifty Shades Of Grey' With These Charts

div.div: A team has combed through the "Fifty Shades of Grey" trilogy to identify, categorize and quantify the salacious bits. The result is a seductive infographic that shows where the naughty parts crop up.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ve08ft&via=Digg&text=Skip To The Sexy Parts Of 'Fifty Shades Of Grey' With These Charts

div.a: Germany Legalized Bestiality In 1969, Moves To Ban It Now

div.div: Germany legalised bestiality in 1969, except when the animal suffered "significant harm," but animal rights groups have campaigned for a change in the law.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yq42m0&via=Digg&text=Germany Legalized Bestiality In 1969, Moves To Ban It Now

div.div: OR, WHY ARE HOT PEOPLE SO MEAN?

div.a: Why Are Mean People So Hot?

div.div: It's not that meanies are more physically attractive than everyone else. They're just very good at fooling us.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/112Vj9h&via=Digg&text=Why Are Mean People So Hot?

div.div: THE iPHONE ALMOST HAD A CLICK WHEEL

div.a: An Interview With The 'Father Of The iPod'

div.div: Known as the "father of the iPod" for his work on the first 18 generations of Apple's music player Fadell was also involved in the hardware design of the original iPhone. Since cutting ties with the firm he's set up Nest, a smart-thermostat that looks like nothing else on the market.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UdlBQV&via=Digg&text=An Interview With The 'Father Of The iPod'

div.div: LIKE THEY DON'T HAVE ENOUGH TO WORRY ABOUT

div.a: Are Parents In Jerusalem Panicking Over A Non-Existant Pedophile Ring?

div.div: The situation is already referred to as the worst pedophile case in Israel’s history. If true, this would be, in terms of the number of perpetrators and the scope of conspiracy, unprecedented in known criminal history. But according to some, pedophile rings just don't exist.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/1152bD2&via=Digg&text=Are Parents In Jerusalem Panicking Over A Non-Existant Pedophile Ring?

div.a: The Inside Story Of Pong And The Video Game Industry's Big Bang

div.div: On Nov. 29, 1972, a crude table-tennis arcade game in a garish orange cabinet was delivered to bars and pizza parlors around California, and a multi-billion-dollar industry was born.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TsTjka&via=Digg&text=The Inside Story Of Pong And The Video Game Industry's Big Bang

div.div: CONGRESS CAN STILL SEE RED INK

div.a: The Stealthiest Victim Of Impending Budget Cuts

div.div: “It is simultaneously too big to fail and too big to succeed.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U3A2F2&via=Digg&text=The Stealthiest Victim Of Impending Budget Cuts

div.a: Someone Is Hijacking Canadian Mail Trucks To Steal Holiday Loot

div.div: With Black Friday sales behind us and the holidays quickly approaching, the volume of goods being sent through the mail is reaching its yearly peak. Unfortunately for a couple of Canada Post drivers in Surrey, British Columbia, someone decided to rob their trucks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11kc0Mn&via=Digg&text=Someone Is Hijacking Canadian Mail Trucks To Steal Holiday Loot

div.div: Canadians eat it for breakfast; Haitians call it mamba and buy it, freshly pulverized, from street vendors; it is popular in the Netherlands, where it is known as pindakaas, or peanut cheese. Nevertheless, it remains an “all-American food.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sf6G98&via=Digg&text=A History Of Peanut Butter

div.a: The Girl Who Grew Lincoln's Beard

div.div: The 16th president achieved follicular fame thanks to an 11-year-old girl.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TtMRw0&via=Digg&text=The Girl Who Grew Lincoln's Beard

div.a: Why Does Slicing Onions Make Me Cry?

div.div: When your knife slices through a crisp onion, it tears through cells, releasing the cells’ contents which just so happens to cause an unpleasant chemical reaction in your eyes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V6awjp&via=Digg&text=Why Does Slicing Onions Make Me Cry?

div.div: THERE WAS A METHOD TO THE MADNESS

div.a: The Science Behind Those Obama Campaign E-Mails

div.div: One fascination in a presidential race mostly bereft of intrigue was the strange, incessant, and weirdly overfamiliar e-mails that emanated from the Obama campaign.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sfiecy&via=Digg&text=The Science Behind Those Obama Campaign E-Mails
